reviews.review_msg: Tara is by far the best prof I've had at SFU. I was anxious about having to do a term of group work, but she made it so easy. She was always accessible if you needed help, and gave very thorough feedback. She is an amazing prof who genuinely wants to see her students do well. Put in the effort necessary, and the class is a breeze!

Group projects are vague at best. No real direction provided during the term-long group project, basically just grasping at straws depending on the availability of current literature of topic. Grading criteria are quite unclear and all topics graded with equal severity even if some topics are more difficult than others. Course structure needs work.

Sper easy course, I did quite literally about 4 hours of work after the first week of October for this course. But the prof is so monotone and boring about every topic except sustainable housing which he absolutely loves.
He was ok, very very boring and dry lecturer. Lots of group projects with no guidelines but he marks them all super super easy.

This was the first class I have ever fallen asleep in. Evening class and he lectured us with no lecture slides for up to 1.5 hours and then having groups give 1-2 hours presentations was extremely hard to sit through as well as actually present. Most of your grade comes from the group term paper and group project presentation.

Professor Saraswat didn't give any grading criteria for anything and made our group paper and group presentation extremely stressful. Even if you asked for help he would be super vague which made it even harder to understand what he wanted. Take this course with Dr. Hippmann instead as she is fantastic and will make the course much more interesting

Arvind lectures were so boring. Everyone was falling asleep. He would just walk around at the front of class for hours with no lectures slides and just talk about whatever came to his mind. There was no grading criteria, and everyone got the same marks in the end. The 1:45 hours presentation was also brutal.

For our group paper worth 40% of our mark and group presentation that was 1:45 hours long we had no criteria and no feedback and gave everyone the same mark except one group. The paper he told me "anywhere from 3-100 pages long.' He will also lecture for up to 2 hours straight with no breaks nor lecture slides which is just soooo much fun.

I was disappointed by the lack of feedback we received for our assignments. It feels like he didn't put much effort in at all. I don't understand how we are supposed to learn and improve as students if we do not receive anything more than a percentage with no reasons given. This class had the potential to be interesting, but unfortunately was not.

Arvind is a really kind and caring prof. Personally I would take another class with him in a heartbeat. He really has a lot of knowledge to share, but is also very receptive to feedback from students.

She's such a nice person but she is so disorganized and most of the time it felt like her grading criteria was just her closing her eyes and throwing darts at a board. Such a tough marker in assignments and the unclear grading criteria made it even harder. I hope she changes how she grades things because her lectures are good and she is delightful
She was so unorganized, her classes were a waste of time and when asked about how homework was marked, she could not give an explanation why we were given the grades we were

Participation required no class time to work on assignments/discuss project with ur group. Shes disorganized, inconsiderate, doesnt convey the purpose of the class thru in-class activities. This was a 3 hour long lecture in the evening and she gave us a break almost never. Shes a good person but a genuinely terrible prof. Awful experience.
